title.string: Chapter 05
Which of the following is a sign of the presence or absence of the concept that one is studying?

description.string: Describe the steps involved in the process of conceptualization.

title.string: Which of the following sequences illustrates the progression of measurement steps in a fully structured scientific study?

title.string: Professor Smith gave the class an exam on Monday. On Wednesday Professor Smith gave the same class the same exam. Professor Smith was clearly interested in assessing the exam’s:

description.string: Distinguish among precision, accuracy, reliability, and validity and discuss how they affect the quality of a measurement technique.

description.string: Describe the steps involved in the process of conceptualization.

title.string: Dr. Jones is developing a research study in which he plans to use the length of a participant's ring finger to determine mathematical prowess. At the most basic level, his indicator fails which test for validity?

title.string: The variable "educational level" of students was measured as last year in the school was completed (i.e., by using attributes such as none, 1st, 2nd, 3rd grades) This type of measurement falls under _____ measures.

title.string: Conceptualization is the development of research procedures that will result in empirical observations representing those concepts in the real world.

description.string: Describe the steps involved in the process of conceptualization.

title.string: Validity refers to the extent to which an empirical measure adequately reflects the real meaning of the concept under consideration.

title.string: Changing definitions almost inevitably results in different descriptive conclusions.

title.string: Please conceptualize child abuse (or another abstract concept of your choice). What indicators would you use to measure the concept? Are there dimensions to the concept?

title.string: How would you measure family size at the nominal, ordinal, and ratio levels?

description.string: Identify and illustrate the many choices you may have in operationalizing variables.

title.string: Provide one example each of how definitions are used in descriptive and explanatory studies. Why might a social scientist say that definitions are more important in descriptive studies than in explanatory ones?

title.string: Dr. Brown is conducting a study on opinions about gun control in the United States. How might she conceptualize and measure this subject? What are some potential biases that might affect the outcomes of her research?

description.string: Explain how measurement decisions can have ethical implications.
